description: General attractiveness and interest level of the SecureView 360 Camera concept as perceived by respondents.
Clarity and strength of the benefits offered by the concept compared to perceived effort or cost.
Customer reactions to the specific features included in the concept, such as 360-degree coverage, AI detection, and night vision.
Perceived usefulness and differentiation of full pan-and-tilt coverage versus fixed-angle cameras.
Customer expectations and opinions regarding the 2K HD video quality.
Perceived usefulness of AI-powered person, pet, and vehicle detection in real-life scenarios.
Concerns about receiving unnecessary or inaccurate motion alerts.
Expectations regarding how fast and reliable instant motion alerts would be.
Concerns or confidence related to data privacy, local storage, and handling of recorded footage.
Customer perception of the one-time purchase model and the absence of mandatory monthly fees.
Reactions to the inclusion of free 7-day cloud storage and whether it is seen as sufficient.
Interest in having local storage as an alternative or complement to cloud storage.
Perceived simplicity and convenience of the installation process and mounting options.
Perceived suitability of the camera for both indoor and outdoor use due to weather resistance.
Reactions to the physical design, size, and visual appeal of the camera.
Perceived value of compatibility with Alexa and Google Home ecosystems.
Customer expectations around using two-way audio for communication, deterrence, or monitoring.
Interest in customizable activity zones, settings, and user control over alerts and monitoring.
Perceived reliability of the camera in terms of connectivity, uptime, and consistent performance.
How respondents compare the concept to existing security camera solutions they know or use.
Perceived relevance of the concept for personal needs such as home security, pet monitoring, or outdoor surveillance.
Likelihood of purchasing the SecureView 360 Camera based on the concept description.
Reactions to the implied pricing model and perceived acceptable price range.
Level of trust respondents feel toward the product concept and the company behind it.
Ideas, feature requests, or changes suggested by respondents to improve the concept.
Feedback that does not clearly fall into any specific category
Feedback that contains any other topic
